title: Mechanical Engineer (Piping) Job at Timospiden Global Services
content:
Timospiden is a global firm of technical and non technical manpower supply company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mechanical Engineer (Piping)

Job Location: Akwa Ibom 

Requirements
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 6-15 years work experience.
	Specialized in construction of Critical Piping, non-critical piping, Utility piping & its associated pipe supports including it associated grouting, painting & Insulation.
	Mandatory experience in Combined cycle Power plant construction Projects
	Familiar with Piping GA drawings, Iso drawings, P&I drawings, Piping Line list, Piping Terminal points, Pipe support drawings (Standard & Non-standard supports like spring supports, snubber supports).
	Able to extract BOQ from Piping Iso drawings
	Able to calculate the Piping weld joints / Dia inch from Iso drawings
	Able to prepare Field weld joints in Iso drawings
	Knowledge in Site fabrication spools (Large bore / small bore) as per codes/standards
	Knowledge in site fabrication of Standard pipe supports like Tee supports, baseplates etc.,
	Able to prepare/set the Daily / Weekly / Monthly Targets for Piping production as per schedule requirements
	Able to prepare Schedule in MS Project / MS Excel format and submit progress report with Plan vs Actuals, Manpower allocation plan, Equipment Allocation plan, Tools & Tackles requirement plan as per schedule requirement.
	Able to calculate surface area of piping systems for painting / insulation work volume arrival / procurement purpose.
	Familiar with using Auto level station / Theodolite machines for Project Benchmark co-ordinates cross check and transferring to Piping work place requirements.
	Conduct Line walkdown before Hydro test / Pneumatic test.
	Familiar with Purging requirements, Blowing requirements, N2 preservation requirements
	Familiar with welding processes and its requirements
	Familiar with all type of major Potential Welding defects & its Control measures
	Familiar with All Hand tools, Machines, Fit up tools, Welding Tools, Fabrication machines, Tools required for Piping production including Rigging tools & gears, Hydraulic Jacks etc.,
	Familiar with Crane selection concept for Erection works
	Familiar with Lifting plan preparation for any Critical Lifting / Erection works taking the location of Centre of Gravity factor into consideration
	Familiar with Piping Metallic expansion bellows fit up and installation
	Familiar with Fit up / welding of dis-similar piping materials & its special requirements
	Familiar with NDT requirements like RT, UT, MT, PT
	Familiar with Pre-heating requirements, Post welding Heat treatment requirements
	Familiar with all Piping materials codes & Specifications especially used in Combined Cycle Power plant projects
	Familiar with selection of appropriate Welding electrodes & its applications.
	Familiar with Hydro test procedures, Able to conduct Hydro test / Pneumatic test with all necessary hydro test kits like Temporary spools, Testing manifolds, Pressure hoses, Pressure gauges etc.,
	Able to understand, study & prepare the Mark up of Test limits (Hydro test / Pneumatic test) of various piping systems in P&I drawing, Able to understand the Hydro test requirements and execute accordingly.
	Familiar with Chemical cleaning procedures after Hydro test of piping systems
	Familiar with Steam blow out procedures after Chemical cleaning of piping systems with temporary spools arrangements/requirements/Walkdowns/Target plate setting and requirements etc.,
	High Safety standards implementation with High Production output generation without compromising Quality & within Cost / Budget allocated.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: nureni.babatunde@energy-mgt.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Head of Collections Job at Ascentech Services Limited
content:
Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Collections
Job Location: Kano
Employment Type: Full-time
Division: Credit & Risk Management
Reports To: National Head of Credit

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly experienced and field-oriented Head of Credit to oversee all credit-related activities across the Northern region, with a base in Kano.
	The ideal candidate must have a strong background in micro-lending, digital loan companies (e.g., Palmpay, Opay), or microfinance institutions, and possess a deep understanding of risk assessment, credit operations, and grassroots lending dynamics.
	This role demands someone who is not only analytically strong but also highly mobile and hands-on—spending time in the field to assess clients directly, work closely with our sales agents, and help us build a strong, responsible loan portfolio.
	Fluency in Hausa is required for effective communication and engagement with local customers.


Key Responsibilities


	Credit Strategy & Operations
	Lead credit operations across the Northern region (Kano, Yola, Abuja) in alignment with the company’s credit risk framework.
	Design, implement, and manage credit approval processes that are tailored to the socio-economic realities of the region.
	Customer Assessment & Field Work
	Collaborate closely with sales agents to identify high-potential and low-risk customers during onboarding.
	Personally conduct or oversee field visits for credit evaluation, especially for larger or high-risk clients.
	Monitor portfolio performance, ensuring high repayment rates and early risk detection.
	Guide and support credit officers, CROs, and recovery agents within the region.
	Ensure all client assessments include proper due diligence, affordability analysis, and KYC verification.
	Promote responsible lending and financial literacy within target communities.
	Team Leadership & Performance Monitoring
	Supervise a regional team consisting of 1 CRO, 1 Loan Officer, and 1 Recovery Agent.
	Develop KPIs and performance dashboards to ensure visibility on credit activities and portfolio health.
	Provide mentorship and support for continuous learning and ethical field practices.
	Stakeholder Collaboration
	Work closely with the National Head of Credit, risk teams, and sales leadership to align strategies.
	Act as the regional liaison for credit-related policy updates and operational changes.
	Collaborate with technology teams to improve credit tools and customer experience.
	Compliance & Reporting
	Ensure strict adherence to credit policies, KYC/AML requirements, and regulatory guidelines.
	Generate and submit regular reports on portfolio performance, delinquency trends, and operational insights.


Required Qualifications & Experience


	Minimum of 5 years of experience in credit, risk management, or loan operations in a loan fintech (e.g., Palmpay, Opay), microfinance bank, or consumer lending institution.
	Proven field experience in customer evaluation, loan disbursement, and collections.
	Deep understanding of grassroots lending, informal sector borrowers, and local market behavior.
	Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration or related fields (MBA or professional certification is a plus).
	Proficient in Microsoft Excel and data-driven decision-making.


Key Competencies & Skills:


	Fluency in Hausa (spoken and written) .
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills for both fieldwork and internal coordination.
	Excellent judgment in assessing borrower risk and ensuring compliance.
	High level of integrity, accountability, and leadership.
	Comfortable working in both office and rural field environments.
	Working Conditions:
	Based full-time in Kano, with frequent travel to Yola and Abuja.
	Combination of office-based responsibilities and regular field assessments.
	May be required to work extended hours based on client or portfolio needs.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Project Engineer (Oil & Gas) Job at Elvaridah
content:
At Elvaridah, we emphasize on the critical matters and prospects of organizations such as business growth, strategy, planning, marketing, structure, and people management across different industries. We help companies focus on the growth of their businesses while aligning costs with strategy. With our all-inclusive approach and expertise, we capture values across the boundaries of any organization. Elvaridah focuses on optimizing all the different parts of a business as a unit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Engineer (Oil & Gas)

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Project Engineer is responsible for coordinating engineering and technical activities related to oil and gas projects.
	This role involves designing, planning, and supporting project execution to ensure compliance with industry standards, safety regulations, and project objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in project planning, scheduling, and execution to ensure timely completion.
	Develop engineering designs, specifications, and technical documentation.
	Coordinate with contractors, suppliers, and internal teams to ensure smooth operations.
	Assist in procurement activities, including reviewing technical bids and specifications.
	Provide technical support and troubleshooting during project execution.
	Prepare project reports, progress updates, and documentation for stakeholders.
	Monitor project performance, ensuring adherence to budget, scope, and quality.
	Ensure compliance with safety regulations, industry standards, and company policies.
	Conduct risk assessments and implement mitigation strategies.
	Collaborate with the Project Manager and other team members to optimize project efficiency.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Civil, Petroleum, or related field).
	4 - 5 years of experience in oil and gas project engineering.
	Knowledge of project management principles and engineering design.
	Familiarity with industry codes and standards (API, ASME, ASTM, etc.).
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
	Proficiency in engineering software (AutoCAD, SolidWorks, or similar).
	Understanding of safety protocols and HSE regulations.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@elvaridah.com using “Project Engineer (Oil & Gas)” as the subject of the mail.
